title: Ticket #5071: adjust condor_q banner to eliminate sinful strings
description:
Brian Bockelman wrote:

One thing I noticed when testing the branch is this in the header for condor_q: 

-- Submitter: hcc-briantest.unl.edu : <129.93.244.208:60359?addrs=[2600:900:6:1301:5054:ff:feab:a9fb]:60359+129.93.244.208:60359> : hcc-briantest.unl.edu

The sinful is now longer than the 80 character width we otherwise use in condor_q output. Are we really gaining much by printing out the sinful? Can we ask TJ his thoughts on simply dropping it?

To which TJ replied:

I'd be in favor of dropping the sinful, and having the Submitter: value actually be the submitter rather than the schedd name. I do think we need to show the schedd name though.

Since the schedd's name is not its Sinful, this looks like it will work out nicely.
remarks:
2015-Jun-08 15:59:11 by johnkn:
The long term plan is to have a method 'summarize_sinful_for_display', and print the output from that. the short term plan is for TJ to write a stupid version of that function by parsing until the first ? and replacing from there to the > with ...
